sentences.sContent: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.sCn: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.sContent: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.sCn: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.sContent: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice .
sentences.sCn: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

trans.tranCn: 牺牲； 献身；牺牲品， 祭品， 供物
trans.tranOther: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important

trans.tranCn: 献祭； 献出； 牺牲
